    • Uses of PlayerStrategy in ca.concordia.app.strategies

      Classes in ca.concordia.app.strategies that implement PlayerStrategy 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  AggressiveStrategy
      This class implements the aggressive strategy An aggressive computer player strategy that focuses on attack (reinforces its strongest country, then always attack with it until it cannot attack anymore, then fortifies in order to maximize aggregation of forces in one country).
      class  BenevolentStrategy
      This class implements the Benevolent Strategy A benevolent computer player strategy that focuses on protecting its weak countries (reinforces its weakest countries, never attacks, then fortifies in order to move armies to weaker countries).
      class  CheaterStrategy
      A cheater computer player strategy whose reinforce() method doubles the number of armies on all its countries, whose attack() method automatically conquers all the neighbors of all its countries, and whose fortify() method doubles the number of armies on its countries that have neighbors that belong to other players.
      class  RandomStrategy
      This class implements the Benevolent Strategy.
      Methods in ca.concordia.app.strategies that return PlayerStrategy 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static PlayerStrategy StrategyFactory.getStrategyByName(java.lang.String name)
